name: subalpine
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
growing on or relating to the parts of a mountain area that are just below the tree line (= the line above which trees do not grow): Lynx typically live in subalpine forests and have large, padded feet for walking on soft snow. The ground is covered at this time of year by a profusion of alpine and subalpine flowers. The tree is an important species of the upper sub-alpine ecosystem. Compare
alpine
More examplesFewer examplesHer research focused on subalpine meadows at elevations between 5,000 and 7,000 feet above sea level.The company actively manages sub-alpine grasslands in the north-west.The route involves a full day of sub-alpine ridge walking.
